author: Simon Rimmer
method: Whisk the egg white in a bowl until stiff peaks form when the whisk is removed. Slowly whisk in the lemon juice, peppermint and icing sugar to a stiff paste. Tip the peppermint mixture onto a work surface dusted liberally with icing sugar and roll out thinly. Use a 5cm/2in cutter to cut out circles and place them onto a baking tray. Chill in the fridge for 1-2 hours, or until the mixture has set. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in a bowl set over a pan of simmering water. (Do not let the base of the bowl touch the water.) Dip each peppermint cream into the melted chocolate and set aside on a baking tray. Chill the peppermint creams until set.
ingredients: 1 free-range egg white,  ½ lemon, juice only,  1 tsp peppermint flavouring,  425g/15 oz icing sugar, plus extra for dusting,  175g/6¼oz dark chocolate
